text: Marjorie Esa (born 1934) is an Inuit artist known for her drawings and stone carvings. She was born in the Nuqsarhaarjuk camp and lives in Baker Lake, Nunavut. Her work is included in the collections of the Winnipeg Art Gallery the National Gallery of Canada and the Art Gallery of Guelph. ==References== Category:1934 births Category:20th-century Canadian women artists Category:21st-century Canadian women artists Category:Inuit artists Category:Living people
title: Marjorie Esa
